issues.description: The documentation shows literal filter syntax with '-f' and '--filter' options, but doesn't clearly indicate that both are aliases for the same option. The documentation presents both forms separately suggesting they're independent options.
issues.impact: Users may be confused about which form to use.

evidence.doc_excerpt:
jira-as fields list -f "story"
jira-as fields list --filter "story"
evidence.cli_output: -f, --filter TEXT         Filter fields by name pattern

issues.recommended_fix: Clarify in documentation that '-f' and '--filter' are aliases. Update example to show only one form or add note: '(-f and --filter are equivalent)'

issues.description: Documentation shows '--type Story' (capitalized, issue type name), but should use '-t' or '--type' with proper JIRA issue type value. The example is ambiguous about whether it's a literal issue type name or a custom value.
issues.impact: Users may not know the correct format for issue type values or which flag to use.

evidence.cli_output: -t, --type TEXT           Specific issue type to check

issues.recommended_fix: Add clarification: 'jira-as fields check-project PROJ --type "Story"' and document valid issue type values (Bug, Story, Task, Epic, Subtask, etc.)

issues.description: Documentation shows only '--check-agile' but the CLI also supports the short form '-a' which is not mentioned in the examples.
issues.impact: Users are not aware of the shorter '-a' option, missing a convenient shorthand.
issues.recommended_fix: Add example showing short form: 'jira-as fields check-project PROJ -a'

issues.description: Documentation does not mention the '-o, --output [text|json]' option for the 'check-project' command, even though it's present in the CLI and documented for other commands under 'Common Options'.
issues.impact: Users cannot format output as JSON using this command without discovering the option independently.

evidence.doc_missing: No example shows 'jira-as fields check-project PROJ -o json'

issues.recommended_fix: Add example: 'jira-as fields check-project PROJ --output json' or 'jira-as fields check-project PROJ -o json'

issues.documented_examples: No description examples for basic field creation
issues.description: The 'Create Field' examples (lines 134-140) don't show usage of the '-d/--description' option even though it's documented in the field types reference section. Only line 140 shows description usage. The other basic examples should optionally show description.
issues.impact: Users may not understand when to use the description option, though this is minor since it's optional.
issues.recommended_fix: Add one example showing description usage earlier, e.g., 'jira-as fields create --name "Complexity Score" --type number --description "Numerical complexity rating (1-10)"'

issues.description: Documentation claims 'The `fields create` command supports the following 12 field types' but the table and examples actually show 12 types (text, textarea, number, date, datetime, select, multiselect, checkbox, radio, url, user, labels). The count is correct (12 types) but the documentation claims 12 when the code supports them.
issues.impact: Minimal - documentation is accurate, just the wording 'following 12 field types' at line 145 could be clearer.
issues.recommended_fix: Confirm that line 145 correctly states '12 field types' - this appears to be already correct. No change needed.

recommendations.details: Clarify that '-f' and '--filter' are aliases. Update examples to show: 'jira-as fields list --filter story' and add note that '-f' is short form.
Update example to show proper quoting and add documentation on valid issue type values (Bug, Story, Task, Epic, Subtask, etc.)

recommendations.action: Add output format example to check-project section
recommendations.details: Add example: 'jira-as fields check-project PROJ -o json' or 'jira-as fields check-project PROJ --output json' to show JSON output capability

recommendations.action: Add short form examples for check-project
recommendations.details: Include examples using '-a' shorthand: 'jira-as fields check-project PROJ -a' in addition to long form '--check-agile'
Add one example early in the create field section showing the optional '--description' flag for clarity on its usage
Line 145 states '12 field types' which appears correct. Verify documentation and CLI agree on the complete list of supported types.

testing_checklist.test: jira-as fields check-project PROJ --type Story -o json
testing_checklist.expected: Returns JSON output of available fields for Story type
Returns JSON with Agile field availability

testing_checklist.test: jira-as fields create --name 'Test Field' --type text --description 'Test' -o json
testing_checklist.expected: Returns created field details in JSON format

overall_assessment.summary: The jira-fields SKILL.md documentation is mostly accurate and comprehensive, but has 3 critical syntax clarity issues and 3 warning-level omissions. The main issues are: (1) unclear about '-f' vs '--filter' alias relationship, (2) missing output format options in check-project examples, and (3) incomplete documentation of all available flags. These are minor issues that don't break functionality but reduce clarity for users. Recommend addressing HIGH priority items before release.
